pull.title: Remove LOCK(cs_main) from decodescript
pull.body:
Completely static RPC call that doesn't change or even look at mutable state anywhere.

Fixes issue #7012

events.message:
Remove LOCK(cs_main) from decodescript

Completely static RPC call that doesn't change or even look at mutable
state anywhere.

issue.title: RPC: decodescript RPC call holds cs_main
issue.body:
There doesn't seem to be any reason for it to hold this lock.

Thoughts?

events.body:
Yes, makes sense, woohoo, a RPC call that can support parallelism.
utACK
(this, incidentally, was the longer-term goal of pushing down the RPC locks in #5711)

issue.title: rpc: remove cs_main lock from `createrawtransaction`
issue.body:
Continues work to remove/push down RPC locks from #7013.
`createrawtransaction` is a pure utility function that doesn't use main's data structures, so it does not require that lock.

**Despite being a one-line change, needs to be reviewed carefully. Although I didn't find any, there may be unguarded use of main data structures deeper in the call chain. Not meant for 0.12**

issue.title: Misc createrawtransaction changes
issue.body:
Contains following cherries from Core:

* Add OP_RETURN support in createrawtransaction RPC call, add tests - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6346
* [RPC] Add optional locktime to createrawtransaction - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5936
* Remove LOCK(cs_main) from decodescript - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7013
* [RPC] Add transaction size to JSON output - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7072
* rpc: remove cs_main lock from `createrawtransaction` - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7156
* [wallet] Clarify rpc help message with regard to rounding - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7332

One of these is yours @dgenr8 :-)

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.12 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.12.

- bitcoin/bitcoin#7013
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7156
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7229
